events.name: onMenuOpenChange
events.description: Handler that is called when the navbar menu open state changes.

events.name: onScrollPositionChange
events.description: Handler that is called when the navbar parent element is scrolled. This event is only dispatched if `disableScrollHandler` is set to `false` or `shouldHideOnScroll` is set to `true`.

children.description: The children to render. Usually navbar elements such as `NavbarBrand`, `NavbarContent` and `NavbarItem`

maxWidth.description: The max width of the navbar wrapper.

parentRef.description: The parent element where the navbar is placed within. This is used to determine the scroll position and whether the navbar should be hidden or not.

isBordered.description: Whether the navbar should have a bottom border or not.

isBlurred.description: Whether the navbar should have a blur effect or not.

isMenuOpen.description: Indicates if the navbar menu is open. (controlled)

isMenuDefaultOpen.description: Indicates if the navbar menu is open by default. (uncontrolled)

shouldHideOnScroll.description: Indicates if the navbar should hide on scroll.

motionProps.description: The motion props to controle the `visible` / `hidden` animation. This motion is only available if the `shouldHideOnScroll` prop is set to `true`.

disableScrollHandler.description: Whether the navbar parent scroll event should be listened to or not.

disableAnimation.description: Whether the navbar menu animation should be disabled or not.

classNames.description: Allows to set custom class names for the navbar slots.
